1000: Ah, my friend. I regret to admit that I made a poor business decision, but facts are facts. I loaned a certain sum of money to a noble by the name of _patsy_, who you may or may not have heard of. The security on the loan was the deed to a valuable piece of property. Now _patsy_ and the deed have both vanished. Rumor has it that %g fell on some hard time financially, but the sum I loaned is not easily swallowed by my enterprises. Tangling with the likes of _patsy_ will likely be dangerous, but I need a champion. Will you help me, my friend, in exchange for a large uncut diamond?
1001: I am sorry to hear that. I understand, of course, but it is disappointing.
1002: That's good to hear. Now then, I have thirty days before I will be forced to dip into my capital. The deed was stolen out of a local establishment called _bank_ in __bank_ together with some other valuables, but the coincidence between _patsy_'s disappearance at the same time the deed did merits investigation. _patsy_'s old residence was _house2_ in __house2_, which I understand is now empty. Other than that, I have no leads. I either need the gold _patsy_ borrowed, the deed to the house, or that aristocrat's head on a stick in thirty days. Don't let me down, %pcf.
1003: You could at least try to fulfill your promise.
1004: _patsy_'s trick didn't work, did it, %pcf? Here's the diamond I promised. Well done, my friend.
1005: _qgiver_ sure wasn't _patsy_'s only dupe. Lots of people loaned %g2 gold.
_patsy_ just left __house2_ suddenly, leaving debts and broken hearts behind.
1006: _patsy_ got away with it all, looks like. I hear %g's up north with a fortune.
_patsy_'s supposedly dead. I don't believe that for a second.
1007: No one's going to try to default on _qgiver_, not after that _patsy_ affair.
All _patsy_ proved was it's not wise to try and cheat someone like _qgiver_.
1010: %qdt: I have thirty days to find the deed that _qgiver_, of __qgiver_, in ___qgiver_ was given as collaterial on a loan to a noble named _patsy_, or to find the gold _qgiver_ gave _patsy_, or, if all else fails, to find the nowhere-to-be-found _patsy_. The collaterial was in _bank_ in __bank_, before the bank was robbed. The only other place I've been told of is _house2_, _patsy_'s old place of residence in __house2_. If I am successful in any of these goals in thirty days, _qgiver_ will give me a large, uncut diamond.
1012: Thank you, sweets. I've heard you're the decent sort, and I thought I'd give you a break. I was hired by _patsy_ a few weeks ago -- not for the reason you're thinkin. All I had to do was flirt with some old gaffer and get him to ask me out to dinner on a specific day. I guess to get him out of his house, because I found out later that the bloke's house was burgled while we was out. Lots of stuff was took, I hear. The old fella was cute and sweet and I felt bad about it. You may want to talk to him. His name's _gaffer_. Or you could go to the place where I met that _patsy_, _house2_ in __house2_ and see if anyone there knows anything. Hope all this helps, %pcf. I'd like to see old _patsy_ put away myself.
1013: %pcn,  If you are anticipating a long and healthy career in the Bay area, I would advise dropping your pointless and doomed hounding. Tragedy is the only possible result, and the tragedy will be your own. I won't be caught, %pcf. I have too much money to be caught.    Yours truly,   _patsy_
1014: %pcn is your target, a %ra adventurer and mercenary. Use extreme caution and be prepared for a fight.  No jellyfish this one.    -- _patsy_
1015: _banker_ works over at _bank_ in __bank_. Perfectly respectable sort.
A banker of typical tediousness. _banker_ works at _bank_ in __bank_.
1016: I'll tell you what I told _patsy_. __banker_ will reimburse all gold lost in the robbery down to the last penny. We just want to answer certain questions about the robbery itself. Things it would be best not discussed with a stranger, you understand.
1017: Ah, good to see you, %pcf. We are having a bit of excitement lately with the robbery and all. Only certain accounts and deposits were targetted, so _guard_, our security agent, is looking into the holders of those accounts. Perhaps %g might be able to give you more information, %pcf. _guard_ is at __guard_ in ___guard_.
1018: I'm afraid I can't discuss this matter with you, %pcn. This affair only concerns _patsy_ and myself, no one else. If you're really interested in helping, go chat with _hooker_, a prostitute who had some kind of relationship with our friend _patsy_. She'll want ten gold pieces to cooperate, and you'll find her over in __house1_ in a place called _house1_. Good luck, %pcf. I may not be here when you get back, but you are certainly capable of carrying on the investigations on your own.
1019: Ah, %pcn, my friend. I think we may be able to help each other in this affair. I know where _patsy_ has gone, but %g3 allies are making it difficult to get to %g2. Millions of gold pieces can buy some powerful friends. I need you to cut off this connection, and then meet me so we can together cut off _patsy_ altogether. Drop this letter off in %g3 allies' stronghold ___mondung_ and then come to ___mondung2_. With luck, the letter should distract those soldiers so _patsy_ will be relatively defenseless, except for %g3 own guards of course. Very good, %pcf, I will be seeing you soon.
1020: _guard_ has left __guard_. Apparently %g knows where _patsy_ has gone.
_guard_ wouldn't have left __guard_ unless %g knew where _patsy_ is hiding.
Everyone's trying to figure out why _guard_ left __guard_ so suddenly.
1021: Change of agenda, folks. I need you in ___qgiver_ right away. Get over there and wait for my response. Shouldn't take longer than a few days.    -- _patsy_
1023: You know immediately that this must be _patsy_.
1024: You have slain _patsy_, without a doubt.
1025: I'm going to need some reinforcements if the rumors about this %ra are correct. Keep the deed in hiding in ___mondung_ but bring the gold and your men over here to ___mondung2_. We'll discuss this further when you arrive.   -- _patsy_
1026: There is a stamp on the piece of _rock_ that reads ___mondung_.
1027: Just a piece of _rock_. Odd finding it lying around ___house2_.
The _rock_ seems to have some kind of stamp on it, or an engraving.
Looks like the stuff they used to mine out of ___mondung_.
1028: The _rock_ says ___mondung_ on it; that's an abandoned mine to the %di.
That _rock_ must have been mined years ago when ___mondung_ was a mine.
1029: This looks like the deed _patsy_ gave _qgiver_ as collaterial.
1030: This appears to be the gold that _qgiver_ loaned to _patsy_.
1031: Nightside Asylum   Dear %pcf,        We understand that you are looking for _patsy_. Because we respect you and your work, we have decided to help you in this matter. _patsy_ used our services once some weeks ago, and we received our payments through a small but fierce band of %g3 allies garrisoned at a camp called ___mondung_. If you are truly interested in finding _patsy_, you would be smart to start there.      Good luck and may Mephala steady thy aim.    -- The Brotherhood
1032: You do not even realize that the young boy is next to you until you feel the letter slip into your hand. By the time you turn, he has disappeared, scurrying away so quickly you do not have a hope of catching him.
1033: %pcn,       _patsy_ is a thief, but not one of ours. We would like %g2 to be caught as well. Please accept this contribution to your expenses, and this other bit of information: _patsy_ is not working alone. There is a gang of mercenaries under %g3 direction in a place called ___mondung_. Some of %g3 treasure may be kept there as well, but I do not think _patsy_ is there.      Good luck, %pcf, and walk with Baan Dar.  -- The Guild
1034: Ah, %pcf, my friend. Again, I have been seduced and betrayed. Truly I should join some monastery. My life would be simpler without women, %oth. Here, take this gold as my contribution toward the capture of that wicked _patsy_. I only wish I could afford to give more, but after recent events, I am impoverished. For your information, _patsy_ has two hideouts in %reg, one in ___mondung_ and one in ___mondung2_. I do not know which if either of these is being used currently, but I would advise you to prepare your finest blade. _patsy_ will not go down easily. Good luck and %god be with you.
1035: Why should I tell you anything I know about anything? You're just a patsy of _qgiver_ who'd screw me like _patsy_ screwed me or that %god damned _hooker_ screwed me. Find some hole like ___mondung_ to crawl in, wither up, and die, you child of a chancred %ra whore.
1036: Dear %pcn,       I might have some information that might help your search for that rat _patsy_. If you're interested, ask for me in __house1_ at a dump called _house1_. And bring 10 gold pieces with you. This information ain't free. _hooker_
1037: "This is from _hooker_," a voice whispers and a young courier hands you a note. Before you can react, he scurries away.
1055: Sorry sweets, my knowledge has a price.
1038: %qdt: _banker_ told me to see _guard_, at __guard_, in ___guard_, who is currently looking into the bank robbery and _patsy_ for _bank_.
1039: %qdt: I have met with _guard_. %g has discovered _patsy_'s location in ___mondung2_. To distract %g3 soldiers, I must drop a letter in %g3 allies stronghold, ___mondung_, and then meet _guard_ at ___mondung2_ to get _patsy_.
1040: %qdt: I have met with _guard_. %g told me that _patsy_ had a relationship with _hooker_, a prostitute in __house1_. I'll find her at _house1_ there.
1041: %qdt: _hooker_ told me that _patsy_ hired her to distract someone named _gaffer_ one night. I can find him at _tavern_ in __tavern_.
1042: %qdt: _gaffer_ told me that _patsy_ has two hideouts, one is ___mondung_ and the other is ___mondung2_.
1050: This document bears witness to the ownership of _house3_ of __house3_ in %reg. Let all who read this know that _patsy_ is the sole and rightful owner of the afore mentioned property.
